shopify.name: shopify
shopify.description:
`ShopifyBuy` only defines one function {{#crossLink "ShopifyBuy/buildClient"}}{{/crossLink}} which can
be used to build a {{#crossLink "ShopClient"}}{{/crossLink}} to query your store using the
provided
{{#crossLink "ShopifyBuy/buildClient/configAttrs:apiKey"}}`apiKey`{{/crossLink}},
{{#crossLink "ShopifyBuy/buildClient/configAttrs:appId"}}`appId`{{/crossLink}},
and {{#crossLink "ShopifyBuy/buildClient/configAttrs:domain"}}`domain`{{/crossLink}}.

CartLineItemModel.name: CartLineItemModel
CartLineItemModel.description: A cart stores an Array of `CartLineItemModel`'s in it's `lineItems` property.

ProductModel.name: ProductModel
ProductModel.description: Class for products returned by fetch('product')

Logger.name: Logger
Logger.description:
Wrapper around the console log so in the future we can have better dev output.
Also allows us to disable output in production.

ShopifyBuy.name: ShopifyBuy
ShopifyBuy.description:
`ShopifyBuy` only defines one function {{#crossLink "ShopifyBuy/buildClient"}}{{/crossLink}} which can
be used to build a {{#crossLink "ShopClient"}}{{/crossLink}} to query your store using the
provided
{{#crossLink "ShopifyBuy/buildClient/configAttrs:apiKey"}}`apiKey`{{/crossLink}},
{{#crossLink "ShopifyBuy/buildClient/configAttrs:appId"}}`appId`{{/crossLink}},
and {{#crossLink "ShopifyBuy/buildClient/configAttrs:domain"}}`domain`{{/crossLink}}.

classitems.description: A line item ID.
classitems.name: id

classitems.description: ID of line item variant.
classitems.name: variant_id

classitems.description: ID of variant's product.
classitems.name: product_id

classitems.description:
Variant's image.
Example `Object` returned:
```
{
   "id": 18723183238,
   "created_at": "2016-09-14T17:12:12-04:00",
   "position": 1,
   "updated_at": "2016-09-14T17:12:12-04:00",
   "product_id": 8569911558,
   "src": "https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1019/0495/products/Mop__three_different_mop_handles.jpg?v=1473887532",
   "variant_ids": []
 }
```
classitems.name: image
imageVariant

classitems.description: Product title of variant's parent product.
classitems.name: title

classitems.description: Count of variants to order.
classitems.name: quantity

classitems.description: Customization information for a product. See here for more info .
classitems.name: properties

classitems.description: Title of variant.
classitems.name: variant_title

classitems.description: Price of the variant. For example: `"5.00"`.
classitems.name: price

classitems.description: Compare at price for variant. The `compareAtPrice` would be the price of the product previously before the product went on sale. For more info go here. If no `compareAtPrice` is set then this value will be `null`. An example value: `"5.00"`.
classitems.name: compareAtPrice

classitems.description:
The total price for this line item. For instance if the variant costs `1.50` and you have a quantity
of 2 then `line_price` will be `3.00`.
classitems.name: line_price

classitems.description: Variant's weight in grams. If no weight is set then `0` is returned.
classitems.name: grams

classitems.description: get ID for current cart
classitems.name: id

classitems.description: Get an `Array` of {{#crossLink "CartLineItemModel"}}CartLineItemModel's{{/crossLink}}
classitems.name: lineItems

classitems.description: Gets the total quantity of all line items. Example: you've added two variants with quantities 3 and 2. `lineItemCount` will be 5.
classitems.name: lineItemCount

classitems.description:
Get current subtotal price for all line items. Example: two items have been added to the cart that cost $1.25
then the subtotal will be `2.50`
classitems.name: subtotal

classitems.description: Get checkout URL for current cart
classitems.name: checkoutUrl

classitems.deprecationMessage: `createLineItemsFromVariants` will be used in the future as it's more descriptive

classitems.name: clearLineItems

classitems.description:
Force update of cart model on server. This function will only be used in advanced situations and does not need to be called
explicitly to update line items. It is automatically called after
{{#crossLink "CartModel/createLineItemsFromVariants"}}{{/crossLink}},
{{#crossLink "CartModel/updateLineItem"}}{{/crossLink}},
{{#crossLink "CartModel/removeLineItem"}}{{/crossLink}},
and {{#crossLink "CartModel/removeLineItem"}}{{/crossLink}}

variants

classitems.description: Product unique ID
classitems.name: id

classitems.description: The product title
classitems.name: title

classitems.description: A product description.
classitems.name: description

classitems.description:
An `Array` of `Objects` that contain meta data about an image including `src` of the images.

An example image `Object`:
```
{
  created_at: "2016-08-29T12:35:09-04:00",
  id: 17690553350,
  position: 1,
  product_id: 8291029446,
  src: "https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1019/0495/products/i11_c3334325-2d67-4623-8cd4-0a6b08aa1b83.jpg?v=1472488509",
  updated_at: "2016-08-29T12:35:09-04:00",
  variant_ids: [ 27690103238 ]
}
```
classitems.name: images
options

classitems.description: An `Array` of {{#crossLink "ProductVariantModel"}}ProductVariantModel's{{/crossLink}}
classitems.name: variants

classitems.description: A read only `Array` of Strings represented currently selected option values. eg. `["Large", "Red"]`
classitems.name: selections

classitems.description:
Retrieve variant for currently selected options. By default the first value in each
option is selected which means `selectedVariant` will never be `null`.

With a `selectedVariant` you can create checkout url
({{#crossLink "ProductVariantModel/checkoutUrl"}}ProductVariantModel.checkoutUrl{{/crossLink}}) or it can
be added to a cart ({{#crossLink "CartModel/createLineItemsFromVariants"}}CartModel.createLineItemsFromVariants{{/crossLink}}).
classitems.name: selectedVariant

classitems.description:
Retrieve image for currently selected variantImage. An example image Object would look like this:
```
{
  created_at: "2016-08-29T12:35:09-04:00",
  id: 17690553350,
  position: 1,
  product_id: 8291029446,
  src: "https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1019/0495/products/i11_c3334325-2d67-4623-8cd4-0a6b08aa1b83.jpg?v=1472488509",
  updated_at: "2016-08-29T12:35:09-04:00",
  variant_ids: [ 27690103238 ]
}
```
classitems.name: selectedVariantImage

classitems.description: name of option. Example values: `"Size"`, `"Color"`, etc.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
an Array possible values for option. For instance if this option is a "Size" option an example value
for values could be: `["Large", "Medium", "Small"]`
classitems.name: values

classitems.description:
get/set the currently selected option value with one of the values from the
{{#crossLink "ProductOptionModel/values"}}ProductOptionModel.values{{/crossLink}} array. For
instance if the option values array had the following `["Large", "Medium", "Small"]` setting `selected` to be
`"Large"`, `"Medium"`, or `"Small"` would be valid any other value would throw an `Error`.
classitems.name: selected

classitems.description: Variant unique ID
classitems.name: id

classitems.description: ID of product variant belongs to
classitems.name: productId

classitems.description: Title of variant
classitems.name: title

classitems.description: Title of product variant belongs to
classitems.name: productTitle

classitems.description: Compare at price for variant. The `compareAtPrice` would be the price of the product previously before the product went on sale. For more info go here. If no `compareAtPrice` is set then this value will be `null`. An example value: `"5.00"`
classitems.name: compareAtPrice

classitems.description: Price of the variant. The price will be in the following form: `"10.00"`
classitems.name: price

classitems.description:
Price of variant, formatted according to shop currency format string.
For instance `"$10.00"`
classitems.name: formattedPrice

classitems.description: Variant weight in grams. If no weight is defined grams will be `0`.
classitems.name: grams
optionValues

classitems.description: Variant in stock. Always `true` if inventory tracking is disabled.
classitems.name: available

classitems.description:
Image for variant. An example image `Object`:
```
{
  created_at: "2016-08-29T12:35:09-04:00",
  id: 17690553350,
  position: 1,
  product_id: 8291029446,
  src: "https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1019/0495/products/i11_c3334325-2d67-4623-8cd4-0a6b08aa1b83.jpg?v=1472488509",
  updated_at: "2016-08-29T12:35:09-04:00",
  variant_ids: [ 27690103238 ]
}
```
classitems.name: image
imageVariant

classitems.description:
Get a checkout url for a specific product variant. You can
optionally pass a quantity. If no quantity is passed then quantity
will default to 1. The example below will grab a checkout url for
3 copies of the first variant:
```
const checkoutURL = product.variants[ 0 ].checkoutUrl(3);
```
classitems.name: checkoutUrl

params.name: quantity
params.description: quantity of variants

classitems.description: get the ID for current reference (not what it refers to, but its own unique identifier)
classitems.name: id

classitems.description:
An object with keys for deprecated properties and values as functions that
will transform the value into a usable value. A depracation transform should
have the value signature function(deprecated_value, config_to_be_transformed)
classitems.name: deprecatedProperties

non-deprecated state.

classitems.description: Proxy to serializer's deserialize.
classitems.name: deserialize

params.name: type
params.description: The pluralized name of the type, in lower case.

params.name: payload
params.description: The raw payload returned by the adapter.

params.name: adapter
params.description: The adapter that yielded the payload.

params.name: existingSerializer
params.description:
The serializer to attach. If
none is passed, then `this.deserialize` will create one for the type.

params.name: opts
params.description:
Options that determine which deserialization method to
use.

props.name: multiple
props.description:
true when the payload represents multiple
models

props.name: single
props.description: true when the payload represents one model.

return.description: an instance of `type` reified into a model.

classitems.name: fetchQueryProducts

params.name: query
params.description: A query sent to the api server containing one or more of:

props.name: collection_id
props.description: The ID of a collection to retrieve products from

props.name: tag
props.description: A list of tags to filter the products by. Accepts up to 10 tags.

props.name: product_ids
props.description: A list of product IDs to retrieve

props.name: page
props.description: The page offset number of the current lookup (based on the `limit`)

props.name: limit
props.description: The number of products to retrieve per page

props.name: handle
props.description: The handle of the product to look up

props.name: updated_at_min
props.description: Products updated since the supplied timestamp (format: 2008-12-31 03:00)

props.name: sort_by
props.description:
Will modify how products are ordered. Possible values are:
                                  `"updated_at"`, `"best-selling"`, `"title-ascending"`, `"title-descending"`,
                                  `"price-descending"`, `"price-ascending"`, `"created-descending"`, `"created-ascending"`,
                                  or `"collection-default"`. Using `"collection-default"` means that products will be ordered
                                  the using the custom ordering defined in your Shopify Admin. Default value `"collection-default"`.

classitems.name: fetchQueryCollections

params.name: query
params.description: a query sent to the api server.

props.name: page
props.description: the page offset number of the current lookup (based on the `limit`)

props.name: limit
props.description: the number of collections to retrieve per page

classitems.name: fetchRecentCart
buildClient

params.name: configAttrs
params.description: An object of required config data such as: `apiKey`, `appId`, `domain`

props.name: apiKey
props.description:
An API Key for your store. Documentation how to get an API Key:
                                   https://help.shopify.com/api/sdks/js-buy-sdk/getting-started#api-key

props.name: appId
props.description:
Typically will be 6 which is the Buy Button App Id. For more info on App Id see:
                                  https://help.shopify.com/api/sdks/js-buy-sdk/getting-started#app-id

props.name: domain
props.description: Your shop's full `myshopify.com` domain. For example: `embeds.myshopify.com`

props.name: myShopifyDomain
props.description: You shop's `myshopify.com` domain. [deprecated Use configAttrs.domain]

return.description: a client for the shop using your api credentials which you can use to query your store.
